content.value:
Ever since I was younger and sped through the Ranger's Apprentice and 
Warriors books, I've loved reading and getting engrossed in books. Only 
recently have I ventured out more and started to add non-fiction to my 
rotation. My reading tastes vary dramatically - I just finished two very
 different but extremely good books:
The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo

Last year I made a goal to read 12 book. I finished book #37 on December
 30th. I had two internships last year and finished my second-to-last 
year of college and still continued to read even if it just meant five 
minutes here or there. The Libby app makes reading exponentially easier 
and gives me the ability to read on the go, find new books, and read 
totally for free because it's linked to my library cards.

Mainly, I think if you start with a goal that you 
find attainable and take just five minutes here or there to read, you'll
 find yourself exceeding your goal and reading for longer. Plus you 
could easily find yourself enjoying the reading and spending your time 
more intentionally.

Overall, reading provides relief from stress, the ability to learn new things (e.g. reading
